Title: Not as user friendly
Cons: The first thing that I noticed is the ON/OFF is hard to operate.  You have to press the button with your finger nail.  If you need to turn the camera in a hurry, good luck !  Another issue is with selection of settings.  Prior designs enabled selections by pressing the dial shaped buttons.  With the new design this dial now rotates and is harder to use.  Overall, I would give this camera a low rating for user friendliness.  The pictures were not as good as the 850.
Pros: I have owned other Canon point and shoot  (SD1000, SD850) but this 890 was not close. The bright side to this camera is a big LCD, 5x optical zoom.  The overall size of camera is small making it handy to carry in pocket.
Comments: I tried to return this camera and wanted to buy a 780.  The 780 has a 3x and is a little more expensive for the rugged body and compactness. Ratings of 780 are better than the 890.  This would have cost me another $50 with buying the 780 and returning the 890.  Please look at the photos of the camera or the 360 view before buying.

Title: Best Point and Shoot I've owned
Cons: its slippery and will fall out of your pocket and/or hip case, keep close track of it haha
Pros: The optics are amazing for a point and shoot, and the optical zoom is amazing.  It has all the fun options of a canon, but you can really make some nice pictures with the manual setting.   I can sum up my love for this camera as follows.... I've lost this camera twice. I bought it when it first came out for $350, then got another one a year later for $200, and now Im going to get another.  I really do not feel the need for anything better than this.  If im gonna do a pro photoshoot ill use an SLR.   For anything low light to high speed activity 890IS all the way (dont be fooled by other models around it either, 970, 880, things like that, they dont come close)

Title: Great Camera
Cons: I have none. Yet.
Pros: It fast on the boot, ready to shoot pictures in seconds. The Clarity of the pictures if Awesome, The battery life on a single charge has been good. Can't go wrong with this choice.
Comments: Great Price on the camera, Newegg ran these on HOT SIZZLING SPECIAL FOR 179.99 free shipping. Every electronics store in my hometown had them for 279.99 or higher.

Title: Small and functional
Cons:
The power button is small and cheap feeling. You won't have to worry about turning it on by accident but if you have big fingers you will have to use a finger nail to push it.
The view finder on this thing is so small why even bother? I personally never use it.
Pros:
Its compact and smooth shape makes it comfortable to carry in a pocket. 
5x Optical zoom.
Good battery life. I can fill a 2gb card with video and pictures and still have plenty of juice left to go back and look at them or delete/edit. 
Image stabilization. 
Takes better pictures than my gf's 10.1mp Casio.
Comments: If I were to accidentally brake this camera today I would probably buy the same model again unless a similar model has more optical zoom. 10mp is enough for what I do and with most of this camera's competition only offering optical zoom in the 3x range I would rather have 5x than extra megapixles.

Title: Nice photos, camera is not user friendly
Cons: HEAT (gets really hot after 15 minutes of usage!!), hard to hold carve design, slow flash between each shots, red eye reduction somewhat not work,
Pros: Nice photos, easy to use software, weight, price, looooong optical zoom
Comments: I'd give 5 if all cons were fixed. I was really upset about the poor holding and heat issue. I've been using Canon battery as well as after market, they both cause heat. Actually the heat level is kinda scary (though it's GREAT HAND WARMER in winter. Ha!) I'd be keen on upgrading as soon as the new replacement model arrives. I've been Canon fan for years, I just wish they make camera with stronger body. I tend to return my camera every 3 months for repair.

Cons: Small: The SD890 IS and SD1000 use different batteries so they can't be swapped.  Still had to buy it though.
Pros: 5x optical zoom is fantastic! And it's still small enough to keep on you everyday. I've owned an sd1000 for about two years and the only thing I still wanted was a better zoom, so I got this one for  my girlfriend. Canon is so durable she dropped hers and its fine, I dropped mine in the water and it was fine after being dried in the sun, it's also been dragged through the dirt and stored in my pocket every day. Menus and functions are pretty intuitive, and much better than some other digital cameras.  The combination of Canon's lenses and a 10MP detector results in great looking pictures, even from a soccer field away.  Combined with a Canon printer, you can print good quality photos quickly with the push of a single button.
Comments: I can't tell you how nice it is to carry a quality camera around in my pocket every day.  I've convinced friend and family to get something besides their huge SLRs.  CaseLogic makes a small neoprene case perfect for these cameras.  I commute everyday and these cameras have come in handy when other people run into my car.

Title: Great Camera
Cons: None
Pros: Great camera, I love Canon's color reproduction
Comments: Cant go wrong with this one

Title: Okay camera
Cons: Hard to operate, hard to pick right setting, hard to turn on and off power, heat issue, hard to grab body, a little bigger size body
Pros: x5 optical lens, 10m pixels, fast zoom, Awesome photo quality
Comments:
Photo quality is awesome, but there are so many cons. Operation is very tough, you need two hands to operate it, you can't change setting from regular-manual-video by one hand (or finger) like I was so used to on SD700. Also power botton is very small and impossible to press with my gloves on. choosing a setting on manual? forget it, use both hands. Placement of all bottons are not user friendly at all. Also, be aware that body heats up aft 5 minutes of continue operation (hand warmer anyone?) 

My 2+ year old SD700 died, and I needed a new camera quick. I read SD890 replaced the 700, thou I read many bad reviews, but I didn't have time so I placed an order. I'm not too crazy about this model at all, I'd say stay away from this model, and wait for the next model to come out (if they ever make 10m 5x optical lens camera...)

Title: Great cam
Cons: see pros
Pros: This provides everything you could expect from a canon SD camera.  All the functions and ease of use make this camera a great choice. I am dissapointed with its overall construction and power button though.  I own the SD700 as well and it is a great camera and its construction is top notch. The sd890 is a little more flimsy and the power button is hard to depress, especially if you trying to take an unexpected pic. I do like the preview button, it is a simple button push to preview the pics you have taken. I would rate this as a 4.8 only becuase of what i hvae mentioned. The photo cababilities are top notch though. Easy point and click to get great shots

Title: Awesome
Cons: Nothing significant.
Pros: Optical zoom can't be beat.  All of the useful features work perfectly.  It's a little heavy, but well worth it for the zoom.  Use of the real viewfinder to track a moving object is a must for "continuous shooting" because the LCD shows the recorded shots, not live. I'm glad they didn't delete it!  Battery life excellent so far.
Comments: Trying to coax some form of manual (well... "less automatic") focus out of it takes a little trial and error, but it's the same for all consumer cameras.  Does offer enough modes to make it do what you want 90% of the time.
